title: Special needs students enjoy Special Olympics’ bowling event
title_page: Special needs students enjoy Special Olympics’ bowling event
maintext:
It’s not about winning for this special group of student bowlers at Brownsville Independent School District, it’s about developing their social skills and making new friends.
BISD high school and middle school special needs students competed in a friendly game of bowling Friday at the GalaxyBowlingCenter as part of the annual BISD Special Olympics.
“Special Olympics is a wonderful national organization that allows students to participate to the best of their ability in sports,” said Mary Helen Lopez, Veterans Memorial Early College High School structured for life special education teacher. “The students absolutely love it. They’re very enthusiastic, they show a lot of sportsmanship, they cheer each other on. They understand the game (and) the rules of the sport, and absolutely love being included in a sport they can compete in.”
kcontreras@brownsvilleherald.com
A more complete version of this story is available on www.myBrownsvilleHerald.com
